summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between U.S. Department of Justice officials in London and New York, discussing a media article about Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation with the Epstein investigation causing diplomatic strain. It also includes internal discussion about a Mutual Legal Assistance (MLA) request related to a witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Duke of York, subject of investigation
persons.context: The central figure whose refusal to cooperate with U.S. investigators into Jeffrey Epstein's network is described as causing diplomatic strain between the UK and U.S. He is accused in a civil lawsuit of sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whose network and abuse of young women and girls is under investigation. His death in 2019 is mentioned.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges. Her prosecution is mentioned as adding strain to UK-US relations alongside the Prince Andrew issue.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Previously stated that U.S. authorities had received 'zero cooperation' from Prince Andrew regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referred to indirectly as the accuser ('her') who filed a civil lawsuit alleging Prince Andrew sexually abused her. Her lawyer, David Boies, is mentioned.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Lawyer representing the accuser who accused Prince Andrew of 'stonewalling' appeals for information.

connections.description: Prince Andrew visited Epstein in various locations, and investigators are seeking details of these visits to understand travel within Epstein's orbit.
Described as Epstein's former girlfriend. She is facing trial for sex trafficking charges related to his network.
A civil lawsuit alleges Prince Andrew sexually abused Giuffre after she was 'lent out for sexual purposes' by Epstein.
Boies is the lawyer representing Giuffre in her civil lawsuit against Prince Andrew.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died in a Manhattan prison; his death was ruled a suicide.

events.title: MLA Request for Prince Andrew
events.description: The U.S. Department of Justice made an application under the US-UK mutual legal assistance treaty to secure cooperation from Prince Andrew.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Virginia Giuffre filed a 15-page civil lawsuit in New York accusing Prince Andrew of sexual abuse.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Pending
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is set to go on trial later in the year on sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Prince Andrew's BBC Interview
events.description: Prince Andrew told the BBC he had not had sex with Virginia Giuffre and had no recollection of meeting her.

locations: 33 Nine Elms Lane, London SW11 7US (U.S. Embassy)
keyFacts: U.S. authorities express growing frustration over Prince Andrew's failure to cooperate with the Epstein investigation, causing diplomatic strain between the U.S. and U.K.
A U.S.-U.K. Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty request has been ineffective in securing Prince Andrew's cooperation.
Investigators are interested in Prince Andrew's flights to visit Epstein in locations like Little St James, Florida, and New York to understand travel within Epstein's network.
A civil lawsuit alleges Prince Andrew sexually abused Virginia Giuffre after she was 'lent out' by Epstein.
Internal DOJ emails discuss a separate MLA request regarding a witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, questioning if the witness is now considered a suspect.
